newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Palestinians say Israel behind Gaza blast.
newsitem.headline: Palestinians say Israel behind Gaza blast.

text.p: An aide to Palestinian President Yasser Arafat said on Tuesday that an Arab killed in Gaza in what Israel called a suicide bombing had died from an explosive charge thrown at him from an Israeli army jeep.

"In Kfar Darom area, an Israeli military jeep hurled a grenade or a bomb at (Palestinian) passersby killing one and wounding others. This is information that we have collected from passersby and victims," Ahmed Abdel-Rahman, secretary-general of the Palestinian cabinet, told Reuters.
A Palestinian dressed in military uniform was ripped apart by an explosion on the main Gaza-Rafah road and seven taxi passengers were wounded in the Tuesday morning blast.
Israeli military authorities said the dead man was a suicide bomber who prematurely blew himself up while trying to attack Jewish targets.
In a separate incident, a second Palestinian was killed when he blew himself up near the Jewish settlement of Netzarim. No one was wounded in the blast.
Abdel-Rahman said local media recently reported that Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu had authorised the Israeli secret service to resume activities in areas under PLO control.

Asked if he was accusing Israel of responsibility for the bombing, he said: "It is premature to say that Mr. Netanyahu has given a green light for operations of this kind. But if such an evidence comes up, I will say that."
A Palestinian witness said he saw an Israeli jeep pointing a gun fitted with some sort of shell bomb driving in front of him moments before the blast.
The Islamic fundamentalist group Hamas denied it was behind the explosions and accused Israel of ordering the blasts to sour relations between Hamas and Arafat's Palestinian Authority.
